title: Secret Ingredient Smoothie
description: Romaine lettuce, milk, strawberries, and banana all blend together in this unique quick and easy smoothie.
ingredients: 0.33333334326744 cup milk, or more as needed
4 frozen strawberries, or more to taste
0.25 teaspoon vanilla extract, or to taste
instructions: Put romaine lettuce into the bottom of a blender pitcher; add enough milk to cover completely and blend on High until smooth.

Drop one strawberry at a time into the blender while still running on High and allow the berry to blend completely before adding the next. Blend one banana chunk at a time into the mixture in the same manner as the strawberries. Thin the smoothie with additional milk to keep smoothie blending properly. Blend vanilla extract into the smoothie.

title: Sesame Mango Smoothie
description: Sesame seeds and cashew butter add a nice nutty flavor to this mango and spinach green smoothie that is a great on-the-go breakfast.
instructions: Layer banana, mango, cucumber, spinach, cashew butter, and sesame seeds in a blender, in the order mentioned; add water. Blend until smoothie is desired consistency, adding more water if desired.

title: Healthy Fruit and Vegetable Smoothie
description: This fruit and vegetable smoothie, made with berries, banana, kale, and spinach, is a great way to start your day or drink post-workout.
instructions: Combine milk, yogurt, strawberries, banana, blueberries, green ice cube, whey, and honey in a blender, in the order listed. Blend until smooth.

title: Lemon Coconut Cleanser
description: Fresh lemon, zucchini, spinach, and mango chunks are blended into this quick and easy smooth coconut cleanser with bright citrus flavor.
ingredients: 4 ice cubes, or more to taste
instructions: Combine mango chunks, lemon, spinach, zucchini, water, ice cubes, and coconut oil in a high-speed blender; blend until smooth.

title: Green Slime Smoothie
description: This is yummy. With a name like this, your kids will love it.
instructions: Place the spinach in the freezer until frozen, at least 1 hour.
Combine the spinach, strawberries, banana, honey, and ice in a blender. Blend until smooth. Serve immediately.

title: The Best Green Smoothie
description: If you're looking for an easy, wholesome green smoothie packed with plant-based ingredients, look no further!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon fresh blueberries, or to taste
instructions: Place apple, spinach, and chia seeds into a blender. Add almond milk and cinnamon and blend until smooth. Pour into a glass and top with blueberries.

title: Green Monster - Spinach Smoothie
description: This banana and spinach smoothie is extra creamy thanks to yogurt added to the mix for a quick and easy, on-the-go breakfast.
instructions: Layer yogurt, banana, and blueberries in a blender, respectively. Add as much spinach to blender that will fit; pour in water. Blend on high speed until smooth, adding the remaining spinach if needed. Add ice for a colder and thicker smoothie. Add more water for a thinner smoothie.

title: Green Smoothie with Ginger
description: This yummy green smoothie with apple and pear gets a little tang from lemon juice and a spicy aroma from fresh ginger.
ingredients: 2 cups fresh spinach leaves, or to taste
instructions: Combine spinach, 1 cup water, apple, pear, lemon juice, flaxseed, and ginger in a blender. Puree until smooth, adding more water if needed.

title: Vegan Kale Smoothie
description: Combine kale, mango, pineapple, banana, and almond-coconut milk for a delicious and nutritious vegan green smoothie the whole family (including your kids!) will love.
ingredients: 1 cup almond-coconut milk, or more if needed
instructions: Combine kale, mango, pineapple, 1 cup almond-coconut milk, banana, chia seeds, and flax seed in a high-performance blender (such as Vitamix®); blend until smooth. Add more coconut milk beverage if mixture is too thick.

title: Iced Green Smoothie
description: This nutrient-packed green juice gets its color from spinach and its taste from apple, banana, and a bit of lemon juice.
ingredients: 0.5 medium apple - peeled, cored, and cut into chunks
instructions: Fill a glass with ice.
Blend spinach and water until smooth. Add apple, banana, and lemon juice; blend to desired consistency. Pour over ice.

title: Any Way You Want It Kale Smoothie
description: Packed with kale, banana, milk, yogurt, and sweetened with a bit of maple syrup or honey, this kale smoothie is as delicious as it is versatile!
ingredients: 3 frozen strawberries, or more to taste
instructions: Blend kale, yogurt, and peanuts together in a blender until smooth. Add milk, banana, strawberries, and maple syrup and blend until desired consistency is reached.

title: Detox Smoothie
description: Blueberries, spinach, soy milk, and a Granny Smith apple are blended together to make this breakfast detox smoothie full of green goodness.
instructions: Combine Granny Smith apple, spinach, blueberries, soy milk, and ice cubes in a blender; blend until smooth.

title: The Drink by Will
description: This green smoothie with tomato, radishes, spirulina powder, and carrot is a savory way to start the day.
instructions: Pour water into a blender. Add tomato, carrot, kale, radishes, lemon, spirulina powder; top with ice cubes. Blend vegetable mixture until smooth.

title: Apple and Kale Smoothie
description: Instead of refueling with a sugary sports drink, try this energizing combination of protein-rich cottage cheese, wholesome kale and applesauce.
ingredients: 1 cup Nordica 1% or Fat Free Cottage Cheese
1 cup chopped frozen kale or spinach
instructions: Combine cottage cheese, applesauce, kale, banana, water, ice, lemon juice, vanilla (if using) and cinnamon in a blender. Blend on high speed for 2 minutes or until very smooth. Serve immediately.

title: Easy and Tasty Green Smoothie
description: This tasty green smoothie with spinach, fruit, and flaxseed is perfect for breakfast or a midday snack.
ingredients: 1 medium navel orange, peeled and cut into chunks
instructions: Combine water, spinach, orange chunks, banana, and flaxseed in a blender; process until smooth, 30 seconds to 1 minute.

title: Frozen Pineapple and Spinach Smoothie
description: Fresh baby spinach, vegan yogurt and milk, and chia seeds provide wholesome flavor to this frozen pineapple smoothie for two.
ingredients: 1 cup lightly packed baby spinach leaves
instructions: Thaw frozen pineapple chunks for 5 minutes.
Combine pineapple chunks, spinach, yogurt, milk, and chia seeds in an electric blender and process until smooth, about 2 minutes.

title: Delicious Fruity Green Smoothie
description: This delicious green smoothie has pineapple, mango, banana, blueberries, and greens of your choice and takes just minutes to make.
instructions: Combine kale and water in a blender; process until no chunks remain. Add banana, blueberries, pineapple, and mango; blend until smooth.

title: Wild Pina Colada Green Smoothie
description: This pina colada green smoothie is loaded with pineapple, coconut, dandelion greens, and cashews delivering a taste of the tropics.
ingredients: 0.25 cup chopped pitted dates, or more to taste
instructions: Blend pineapple, coconut water, ice cubes, dandelion greens, coconut, cashews, and dates in a blender until smooth and creamy.

title: Ann's Berry Green Smoothie
description: Blueberries, strawberries, and spinach are blended with milk and honey creating a quick and easy, on-the-go strawberry smoothie.
ingredients: 1.5 cups fresh spinach, or to taste
instructions: Place strawberries in a bowl; add warm water.
Blend milk and spinach together in a blender until smooth. Add blueberries, banana, and honey and blend until smooth. Add strawberries-water mixture and lemon juice and blend until smooth.

title: Fruity Green Matcha Smoothie
description: Blended with mango, spinach, and strawberries, this matcha smoothie makes a healthy, filling breakfast or on-the-go snack.
instructions: Combine milk, yogurt, strawberries, mangos, matcha, honey, and spinach in a blender, in that order. Process until smooth. Make sure you don't over-blend, this can affect the quality of your smoothie!

title: Good Morning Green Smoothie
description: Packed with vegetables and fruit, this gluten-free and dairy-free green smoothie is a powerful way to start the day.
instructions: Blend water, romaine lettuce, cucumber, avocado, celery, spinach, and lemon juice together in a blender on high until smooth, about 30 seconds. Add ice, apple, and banana to blender and blend until smooth, about 30 seconds.

title: Matcha-Berry Swirl Smoothie
description: This quick and easy smoothie is packed with colorful fruits and vegetables and blended with matcha green tea powder to energize every sip.
instructions: Combine spinach, 1 cup orange juice, peaches, pineapple, 1 halved banana, and green tea powder in a blender; blend until combined. Pour smoothie into a glass.
Rinse out the blender.
Combine 1 cup orange juice, raspberries, strawberries, and 1 halved banana in the blender; blend until combined. Pour berry smoothie into a separate glass.
Combine smoothies by pouring them at the same time from opposite sides of the serving glass.

title: My Green Protein Smoothie
description: Packed with healthy ingredients like kale, spinach, and fruit, this green smoothie is great as a snack but also works for a pre- or post-workout meal.
instructions: Combine kale, spinach, strawberries, yogurt, banana, apple, and protein powder in a blender; pulse on low speed until ingredients are broken up and gently mixed. Increase to high speed, and blend until smooth and greens are broken down, 30 to 60 seconds.
Taste and add sugar if you like.

title: Green Turmeric Smoothie
description: This green smoothie is full of superfood ingredients like turmeric, spinach, almond butter, hemp hearts, maca, and chia seeds.
instructions: Place coconut milk, spinach, mango, banana, beet, coconut oil, parsley, turmeric, almond butter, maca powder, hemp hearts, chia seeds, bee pollen, cinnamon, ground ginger, salt, and pepper in a high-speed blender (such as Vitamix®). Blend until smooth.

title: Blueberry Smoothie Bowl
description: A blueberry and banana smoothie is topped with coconut and almonds in this quick and easy blueberry smoothie bowl recipe.
instructions: Blend blueberries, 1/2 banana, water, cashew butter, and vanilla extract together in a blender until smooth; pour into a bowl.
Top smoothie with sliced banana, almonds, and coconut.

title: Acai Bowl
description: Acai berry sorbet is topped with granola, strawberries, and banana this the fruity recipe for an acai bowl similar to those found in Hawaii.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons unsweetened coconut flakes, or as desired
instructions: Place acai sorbet in a bowl and top with a layer of granola. Line strawberry and banana slices on granola layer and top with coconut flakes and a drizzle of honey.

title: Overnight Oats Blueberry Smoothie Bowl
description: Overnight oats and blueberries are blended and topped with coconut and chia seeds in this colorful smoothie bowl recipe.
ingredients: 1.25 cups unsweetened vanilla-flavored almond milk, divided
1 teaspoon maple syrup, or to taste
instructions: Combine oats and 2/3 cup almond milk in a bowl; cover and refrigerate until milk is absorbed by oats, 8 hours to overnight.
Combine oats-almond milk mixture, remaining almond milk, banana, blueberries, vanilla, and maple syrup in a blender; blend until smooth.
Pour smoothie into 2 bowls, then top with coconut, blueberries, and chia seeds.

title: Easy Acai Smoothie Bowl
description: Try this easy acai smoothie bowl with bananas, blueberries and almond milk. Garnish with berries, nuts, or granola to your liking.
ingredients: 7 ounces frozen unsweetened acai pulp, partially defrosted in refrigerator overnight
0.75 cup almond milk, or more as needed
2 tablespoons fresh blueberries, or to taste
1 tablespoon pomegranate seeds, or to taste
1 tablespoon large coconut flakes, or to taste
instructions: Combine acai, bananas, blueberries, almond milk, and honey in a blender. Blend until smooth. Smoothie should have a thick consistency, like frozen yogurt.
Pour into 2 bowls and top with banana slices, blueberries, pomegranate seeds, and coconut.

title: Acai Mango Smoothie Bowl
description: Acai, mango, almond milk, oats, and chia seeds make a fantastic smoothie bowl for 2, just in time to start the day with something delicious.
ingredients: 4 ounces frozen unsweetened acai pulp (such as Sambazon®)
instructions: Place almond milk, mango, bananas, rolled oats, and acai pulp in a blender; blend until smooth. Pour into 2 bowls and top with chia seeds and drizzle with maple syrup.

title: Backyard Berry Bowl
description: A berry smoothie is topped with more berries, banana, and granola in this quick and easy smoothie bowl.
ingredients: 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed
instructions: Blend ice, 1/2 cup strawberries, 1 banana, blackberries, and apple juice together in a blender until smooth, adding more ice depending on your desired consistency. Pour smoothie into a bowl.
Top smoothie with remaining strawberries, remaining banana, blueberries, and granola. Drizzle honey over the top.

title: Green Smoothie Bowl
description: A green smoothie is topped with berries, chia seeds, granola, and coconut in this colorful and hearty green smoothie bowl.
instructions: Blend spinach, banana, coconut milk, mango, and coconut water in a blender until smooth. Pour smoothie into a bowl and top with raspberries, blueberries, granola, coconut flakes, almonds, and chia seeds.

title: Berry Smoothie Bowl
description: A strawberry-pineapple smoothie is topped with blueberries, raspberries, almonds, and granola in this tasty berry smoothie bowl.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons frozen acai berry pulp, or as desired
instructions: Blend strawberries, pineapple, yogurt, coconut water, and acai pulp in a blender until smooth; pour into a bowl. Top smoothie with kiwi, banana, blueberries, raspberries, almonds, granola, and chia seeds.

title: Banana Coconut Smoothie Bowl
description: This banana and peach smoothie is topped with coconut, almonds, and raisins creating a paleo-friendly smoothie bowl for a quick breakfast.
instructions: Blend 1/2 banana, peaches, applesauce, water, and coconut oil together in a blender until smooth; pour into a serving bowl.
Slice remaining half banana and arrange on top of smoothie. Add shredded coconut, almonds, and raisins.

title: Protein Smoothie Bowl with Berries, Chocolate Chips, and Granola
description: This quick and easy smoothie bowl features protein powder, strawberries, blueberries, chocolate chips, and granola. A great way to start the day!
instructions: Combine strawberries, milk, 1/3 cup granola, blueberries, protein powder, and vanilla in a blender; blend until smooth.
Layer 1/2 of the chocolate chips on the bottom of a bowl. Pour smoothie over top, then sprinkle with remaining chocolate chips and remaining granola.

title: Mango Smoothie Bowl
description: This easy mango smoothie bowl with banana and coconut milk is a great start into the day. You can change up the fruit for garnish to your liking.
ingredients: 0.75 cup coconut milk, or to taste
1 teaspoon agave syrup, or to taste
1 tablespoon coconut flakes, or more to taste
6 pieces fresh raspberries, or more to taste
instructions: Combine mango, milk, banana, and agave syrup in a blender; blend until smooth.
Pour into a bowl. Garnish with rows of banana, pomegranate seeds, flaked coconut, and raspberries.

title: Snow Miser Smoothie Bowl
description: Inspired by Snow Miser from "The Year Without Santa Claus," this vibrant, fresh smoothie bowl is the perfect pick-me-up for breakfast, or any time of the day!
ingredients: 1 small apple - peeled, cored, and cut into chunks
1 small pear - peeled, cored, and cut into chunks
instructions: Combine the banana, apple, and pear in an electric blender. Add ice cubes, skyr, all but one big spoonful of coconut, and spirulina.

Remove 3 or 4 balls of dragon fruit using a fruit baller, then add the remaining dragon fruit to the blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into a bowl. Top with reserved dragon fruit balls and remaining coconut.

title: Acai Rainbow Smoothie Bowl for 2
description: Frozen berries and acai pulp, topped with fresh fruits, granola, and agave, make for an amazing and refreshing smoothie bowl for two.
ingredients: 4 ounces frozen unsweetened acai pulp (such as Sambazon®)
instructions: Place frozen berries, almond milk, banana, and acai pulp in a blender; blend until smooth. Pour into 2 bowls and top with granola, mango, strawberries, and kiwi slices. Drizzle with agave syrup.

title: Chef V's Smoothie Bowl
description: Fruit, coconut water, and Greek yogurt are blended together, poured into a bowl, and topped with chia seeds in this smoothie bowl recipe.
instructions: Combine yogurt, coconut water, strawberries, peaches, mango, banana, and 1 tablespoon chia seeds in a blender; blend until smooth. Pour smoothie into a bowl and top with remaining 1 tablespoon chia seeds.

title: Paleo and Vegan Tropical Acai Bowl for Two
description: Start the day with this quick and easy acai bowl made with pineapple, mango, and chia seeds. Made in just minutes and totally ideal for Paleo and vegan diets.
ingredients: 7 ounces frozen unsweetened acai pulp (such as Sambazon®)
1 cup iced water, or as needed
instructions: Place mango, pineapple, acai, water, and lime juice in a blender; pulse until smooth and creamy. Pour mixture into 2 bowls; sprinkle with shredded coconut and chia seeds. Drizzle with agave.

title: Pumpkin-Spice Latte Bombs
description: Inspired by cocoa bombs, these white chocolate spheres contain instant coffee and pumpkin pie spice that meld into a hot cup of coffee turning it into your own pumpkin-spice latte at home.
instructions: Break 4 ounces of the white chocolate into small pieces and place in a medium microwave-safe bowl; microwave on HIGH, stirring at 30-second intervals, until melted, about 1 1/2 minutes. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of the melted chocolate into each of 6 (1 3/4-inch) silicone ball molds. Immediately flip mold over onto a cutting board or plate to allow chocolate to drip off and coat the mold. Let stand 2 minutes. Flip back over and use an offset spatula to scrape the tops of molds to clean them off, placing any dripped chocolate back into the bowl. Place silicone mold in freezer to set, about 5 minutes. Release chocolate "cups" from silicone molds; set aside. Repeat with another 4 ounces of chocolate.
While the molds chill, stir together beverage mix and pumpkin pie spice in a small bowl. Spoon 2 teaspoons of the mixture into 6 of the "cups."

Place the bowl of the leftover melted chocolate back in the microwave; microwave on HIGH until melted, about 30 seconds. Spoon or pour into a small zip-top plastic bag or piping bag and snip off 1/16-inch of the corner. Pipe a thin chocolate line along the edge of the 6 filled white chocolate cups. Place remaining 6 cups on top, using the white chocolate line as glue. Smooth out with your finger, and gently place in silicone mold; freeze until set, about 5 minutes.
Remove the balls from freezer, and dip an offset spatula in very hot water; use it to smooth out edges of the chocolate ball seam. Set aside.

Break remaining 2 ounces of chocolate into pieces, and place in a small microwave-safe bowl; microwave on HIGH until melted, about 30 seconds. Add food coloring, and stir to combine. Place in a separate ziplock bag and snip off 1/16-inch from a corner. Pipe in a zig-zag pattern on the balls. Freeze until set, about 5 minutes.
To serve, brew an 8- to 10-ounce cup of your favorite coffee. Place a bomb in the hot cup of coffee and stir to melt.

title: Starbucks Caramel Frappuccino Copycat Recipe
description: See how to make a caramel frappuccino at home by blending coffee with milk, caramel sauce, and ice. Top with whipped cream and even more caramel if desired!
ingredients: 1 cup strongly brewed black coffee, cooled
instructions: Blend ice, coffee, milk, caramel sauce, and sugar together in a blender on high speed until smooth.
Pour into two 16-ounce glasses.

title: Mexican Mocha
description: Mexican mocha is a wonderful hot drink with cocoa powder, chili, cinnamon, and coffee.
instructions: Combine powdered sugar, cocoa powder, cinnamon, and chili powder in the bottom of a mug.
Pour hot coffee on top and stir until dissolved. Pour in half-and-half creamer and stir.
Top with whipped cream and sprinkle with cinnamon, if desired.

title: How to Make a Cafe Latte
description: Learn how to make a cafe latte for a warm, delicious mug of steamy milk and bold espresso right at home. This is a great recipe for all coffee lovers.
ingredients: 1.3300000429153 cups hot freshly brewed dark roast espresso coffee
instructions: Heat milk in a saucepan set over medium-low heat. Whisk briskly with a wire whisk to create foam.
Brew espresso and pour into four cups. Pour in milk, holding back the foam with a spoon. Spoon foam over the top.

title: Iced Caramel Macchiato
description: This iced caramel macchiato is made with cold brew coffee and milk, vanilla syrup, and a drizzle of caramel sauce for a sweet and creamy summer drink.
ingredients: 4 ounces Gevalia® Cold Brew Concentrate - House Blend
instructions: Pour vanilla syrup into a drinking glass. Add ice cubes, then pour in milk.
Slowly pour in cold brew concentrate. Drizzle with caramel sauce.

title: Homemade Coffee Creamer
description: This homemade coffee creamer recipe uses sweetened condensed milk, skim milk, and vanilla extract to make the easiest, quickest cream for your coffee.
instructions: Combine sweetened condensed milk, skim milk, and vanilla in an airtight container; shake well to blend. Label the container with the expiration date of the milk used.

title: Mexican Coffee Cocktail
description: This Mexican coffee cocktail is a simple-to-make, invigorating warm cocktail made with coffee liqueur, tequila, coffee, and topped with whipped cream.
ingredients: 1 fluid ounce coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®)
instructions: Stir together coffee liqueur and tequila in a mug. Pour in hot coffee and top with whipped cream.

title: Baileys Flat White Martini
description: This espresso martini with Baileys Original Irish Cream is as easy as 1, 2, 3. Impress your guests with this fancy cocktail at your next dinner party!
instructions: Pour Baileys, vodka, and espresso into a cocktail shaker. Add ice; shake well and strain into a martini glass.

title: Homemade Caramel Latte
description: This caramel coffee latte recipe is tastier than Starbucks and simple to make on the stovetop with milk, brown sugar, caramel sauce, and vanilla.
instructions: Combine milk and brown sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. Heat until frothy and close to simmering, about 3 minutes. Reduce heat to low; whisk in caramel sauce and vanilla. Stir in coffee.

title: French Press Cold Brew
description: Perfect French press cold brew with a coffee-to-water ratio that is just right. Learn how to make cold brew coffee at home with this easy recipe.
ingredients: 2 cups filtered water, at room temperature
instructions: Pour ground coffee into a French press container and add water. Place plunger lid on top and press the plunger down 1 to 2 inches to make sure all coffee grounds are fully submerged; do not press all the way down. Let coffee steep at room temperature for 16 to 18 hours.
Strain coffee through a coffee filter in a small strainer. Transfer to an airtight bottle or jar and keep in the refrigerator for up to a week.

title: Vanilla Latte
description: Enjoy this vanilla latte without waiting in the drive-through line! Use your home espresso machine and steaming wand to get coffee shop results, at home.
instructions: Pour milk into a steaming pitcher and heat to 145 to 165 degrees F (65 to 70 degrees C) using the steaming wand of an espresso machine.
Pour espresso over vanilla syrup in a large coffee mug. Pour steamed milk over espresso, using a spoon to hold back the foam. Spoon foam over top.

title: Eggnog Latte
description: It wouldn't be Christmas without one (or several!). If you have a home espresso machine, this is a great holiday coffee treat.
instructions: Pour milk and eggnog into a steaming pitcher and heat to between 145 degrees F to 165 degrees F (65 to 70 degrees C) using the steaming wand. Brew the shot of espresso, then add to mug. Pour the steamed milk and eggnog into the mug, using a spoon to hold back the foam. Spoon foam over the top. Sprinkle nutmeg on top of the foam.

title: Pumpkin Spice Coffee
description: Give your cuppa joe a nice, warm spicy taste with allspice and cinnamon. Just add the spices to coffee in your drip machine.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons half-and-half cream, or to taste
1 teaspoon white sugar, or to taste
instructions: Mix the ground coffee, allspice, and cinnamon in a small bowl, and place into the filter of a drip coffee maker. Pour 4 cups of water into the coffee maker, and turn on the machine. When coffee has finished dripping, pour into 2 cups. Stir in cream and sugar to taste.

title: Coffee Nudge
description: So good on a blustery day! Warms you from the inside out.
instructions: In the bottom of 8 coffee mugs, pour 1 ounce each coffee liqueur and brandy. Pour in 1/2 ounce each creme de cacao. Fill each cup with hot coffee and garnish with a dollop of whipped cream and chocolate sprinkles.

title: Coffee Liqueur
description: A simple syrup, vanilla and instant coffee are combined with vodka and vanilla in this homemade version of the popular after dinner cordial.
instructions: In a 3 quart saucepan over medium heat, combine the sugar and water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat, stir in instant coffee, and allow to cool.
When cool, stir in vanilla extract and vodka. Pour into clean bottles. Close bottles tightly, and store in a cool dark place.

title: Irish Cream and Coffee
description: Irish cream coffee simply uses Irish cream liqueur instead of cream and sugar to create an after-dinner coffee cocktail. Easy and delicious!
ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Irish cream liqueur
instructions: Pour hot brewed coffee into a glass mug; stir in Irish cream liqueur.

title: Dalgona Coffee (Whipped Coffee)
description: Make your own light and creamy whipped coffee to serve over milk when you can't get to a cafe or coffee shop.
instructions: Whisk boiling water, instant coffee, and sugar together until coffee is dissolved. Continue to whisk until mixture becomes thick and forms a peak, 2 to 3 minutes.
Pour milk into a glass. Pour the frothy coffee on top of the milk.

title: Spanish Coffee
description: This Spanish coffee cocktail spiked with overproof rum, triple sec, and coffee liqueur is lit on fire for dramatic effect.
ingredients: 0.75 fluid ounce triple sec (such as Bols®)
2.5 fluid ounces coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®)
instructions: Pour sugar into a shallow dish. Wet the rim of the glass and dip in sugar to coat. Add rum and triple sec. Use a long match or lighter to carefully ignite the mixture. Turn glass slowly until sugar begins to caramelize. Pour in coffee liqueur to put out the flame. Top with hot coffee.
